    PeCorA

    PeCorA.Rmd
    # set global chunk options
library("knitr")
opts_chunk$set(size='tiny')

    PeCorA will estimate the significance of interaction between the peptides mapping to a protein and the treatment variable supplied.

    # proteins with peptides to test
proteins <- c("APOE", "BIN1")

# Categorical treatment
m <- PeCorA(m,
            treatment = "var_y",
            control_group = "A",
            proteins = proteins)
    ## Number of proteins tested: 2
    ## Number of peptides tested: 49
    ## Number of uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 0
    ## Number of proteins with uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 1
    # Show fData for those proteins
head(fData(m)[fData(m)[["Protein"]] %in% proteins, ])
    ##                                Protein                   Peptide
## BIN1@AAPQWCQGK                    BIN1                 AAPQWCQGK
## APOE@AATVGSLAGQPLQER              APOE           AATVGSLAGQPLQER
## BIN1@ADETKDEQFEQCVQNFNK           BIN1        ADETKDEQFEQCVQNFNK
## BIN1@AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK    BIN1 AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK
## APOE@AKLEEQAQQIR                  APOE               AKLEEQAQQIR
## APOE@ALMDETMK                     APOE                  ALMDETMK
##                                pecora_pval_var_y pecora_adj_pval_var_y
## BIN1@AAPQWCQGK                         0.2601326             0.9188922
## APOE@AATVGSLAGQPLQER                   0.9978121             0.9978121
## BIN1@ADETKDEQFEQCVQNFNK                0.9715088             0.9790761
## BIN1@AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK         0.7017853             0.9790761
## APOE@AKLEEQAQQIR                       0.3292363             0.9978121
## APOE@ALMDETMK                          0.8285754             0.9978121

    Running PeCorA again will add new results to fData.

    # Numeric treatment
m <- PeCorA(m,
            treatment = "var_x",
            proteins = proteins,
            median_mod = FALSE)
    ## Number of proteins tested: 2
    ## Number of peptides tested: 49
    ## Number of uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 1
    ## Number of proteins with uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 1
    # Display part of results
head(fData(m)[fData(m)[["Protein"]] %in% proteins, ])
    ##                                Protein                   Peptide
## BIN1@AAPQWCQGK                    BIN1                 AAPQWCQGK
## APOE@AATVGSLAGQPLQER              APOE           AATVGSLAGQPLQER
## BIN1@ADETKDEQFEQCVQNFNK           BIN1        ADETKDEQFEQCVQNFNK
## BIN1@AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK    BIN1 AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK
## APOE@AKLEEQAQQIR                  APOE               AKLEEQAQQIR
## APOE@ALMDETMK                     APOE                  ALMDETMK
##                                pecora_pval_var_y pecora_adj_pval_var_y

## BIN1@AGDVVLVIPFQNPEEQDEGWLMGVK         0.8897301             0.9911427
## APOE@AKLEEQAQQIR                       0.7956260             0.9886037
## APOE@ALMDETMK                          0.9142671             0.9886037
    # Update results - use median_mod = TRUE this time
m <- PeCorA(m,
            treatment = "var_x",
            proteins = proteins,
            median_mod = TRUE)
    ## Number of proteins tested: 2
    ## Number of peptides tested: 49
    ## Number of uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 0
    ## Number of proteins with uncorrelated peptides (1% FDR): 1
    # Display part of results
head(fData(m)[fData(m)[["Protein"]] %in% proteins, ])
    ##                                Protein                   Peptide
## BIN1@AAPQWCQGK                    BIN1                 AAPQWCQGK

    Finally, plot_PeCorA can plot a particular feature (peptide) against all other peptides mapping to the same protein, and will include the adjusted p-value for that peptide in the plot subtitle. Depending on the type of the treatment variable (categorical vs.Â numeric) a boxplot or scatterplot is made, respectively. The parameter median_mod can be set to TRUE to aggregate (samplewise) all other peptides mapping to the same protein using the median.

    # Feature (peptide) to plot
peptide <- "VFEEMNVDLQEELPSLWNSR"
protein <- "BIN1"

# Numeric treatment - scatterplot
p1 <- plot_PeCorA(m, 
                  peptide = peptide, 
                  protein = protein,
                  treatment = "var_x", 
                  median_mod = FALSE)
p1

    # Categorical treatment - boxplots
p2 <- plot_PeCorA(m, 
                  peptide = peptide, 
                  protein = protein,
                  treatment = "var_y", 
                  median_mod = FALSE)
p2

    Since this is a ggplot object, we can modify it as needed.

    # Change y-axis limits and theme
p3 <- p2 + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-6, 8),
                     expand = expansion(mult = 5e-3)) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom")
p3
